title: More early Black Friday 2021 cycling deals | 12 of the best bargains
content:
Black Friday 2021 officially takes place on 26 November, but that hasn’t stopped the biggest retailers from releasing early Black Friday deals. Here is BikeRadar’s selection of the best early Black Friday cycling deals we’ve found so far.

GoPros, helmets, GPS computers and more are all here. You might be looking for a Christmas present for a cyclist, or perhaps you just want to treat yourself (you deserve it after all) – either way, Black Friday’s the time to nab a bargain.

In this article, we’ve picked out the best cycling deals available ahead of Black Friday 2021. We’ll keep this page up-to-date with the best offers leading up to the day itself.

Scroll further down and you’ll see we’ve also answered a few key questions about Black Friday.

The best early Black Friday 2021 cycling deals

Elite Direto smart trainer – £769.99 £499.99 (save 35%)

Ben Delaney / Immediate Media

The Elite Direto is a few years old now and the brand has since released a number of updates including the most recent Elite Direto XR.

But, having scored 4.5 stars in our original review, we reckon this model of the Elite Direto is still worth a look because it offers a smooth riding experience, accurate power measurements and is Zwift-compatible.

Getting a smart trainer for under £500, and with this much of a discount, is also not something to be shrugged at in these times.

  • Buy the Elite Direto smart turbo trainer with a 35% saving from Wiggle

Oakley Radar EV Path PRIZM – £215 £129.99 (save 40%)

Jack Luke / Immediate Media

The Oakley Radar EV Path PRIZMs are a popular set of cycling glasses.

One of the best features of these glasses is the PRIZM lens, which is said to boost colour, contrast and clarity.

This version of the glasses from Chain Reaction Cycles comes with two lenses, increasing the versatility of the glasses. One lens is for normal light conditions and the other is for low light, which is perfect for this time of year.

  • Buy the Oakley Radar EV Path PRIZM with a 40% saving from Chain Reaction Cycles

Shimano GR9 MTB shoes – £139 £80 (save 42%)

Immediate Media

The Shimano GR9 MTB shoes have a great fit and are equally comfy on and off the bike. They are stiff enough for long rides and the Michelin sole provides plenty of grip on the pedals, even when riding over rough terrain.

While vents mean they’re not watertight, we found the shoes don’t get heavily waterlogged and dry pretty quickly too.

  • Buy the Shimano GR9 MTB shoes with a 42% saving from Sigma Sports

Giro Empire Road Shoes – £274.99 £137.50 (save 50%)

Giro

If you’re after a classic look, you can’t go too far wrong with the lace-up Giro Empire Road Shoes.

The shoes have a breathable upper, carbon fibre sole and claimed weight of 225g per shoe.

  • Buy the Giro Empire Road Shoes with a 50% saving from Chain Reaction Cycles

Shimano 105 R7000 pedals – £124.99 £74.99 (save 40%)

David Caudery / Immediate Media

We gave the Shimano 105 R7000 pedals a full five stars when we reviewed them earlier this year, praising their top performance and adjustability. This earned them a place in our best road bike pedals list.

The pedals have tech that has trickled down from Shimano’s top-of-the-line Ultegra and Dura-Ace pedals. They are perfect if you’re looking to knock a few grams off your bike build while ensuring value for money.

  • Buy the Shimano 105 R7000 pedals with a 40% saving from Wiggle

Garmin Edge 530 – £259.99 £199.99 (save 23%)

Matthew Allen / Immediate Media

The Garmin Edge 530 is one of the best bike computers we have tested, scoring 4/5 stars in our 2019 review.

There are a few deals floating about on this computer, but Wiggle currently has the best price at £199.99.

  • Buy the Garmin Edge 530 with a 23% saving from Wiggle

GoPro Hero 9 – £429.98 £329.98 (save 26%)

GoPro

If you love sharing your shreddy adventures, you’ll love the GoPro Hero 9. Though it has been superseded by the Hero 10, it’s still a seriously capable bit of kit for any budding YouTube superstar.

GoPro itself seems to have the best price online currently, with its £329.98 bundle shipping with a memory card, handle, spare battery and clip.

  • Buy the GoPro Hero 9 bundle with a 26% saving direct from GoPro

Specialized S-Works Vent shoes – £399.99 £218 (save 45%)

Jack Luke / Immediate Media

Summer is probably a million miles away from the mind of those in the northern hemisphere but, if you live in a hot climate, these Specialized S-Works Vent shoes are well worth a look.

At a fearsome £399 at RRP, these are a little easier to stomach at £218 on Sigma Sports.

  • Buy the Specialized S-Works Vent shoes with a 45% saving at Sigma Sports

WTB Byway TCS fast gravel tyres – £54.99 £24.99 (save 55%)

David Caudery / Immediate Media

If you’re looking for a go-fast gravel tyre, you could do worse than the WTB Byway. Though they’re definitely not the best option for wet or muddy conditions, for well-surfaced gravel roads, our testers found them to be a hard-wearing and fast-rolling option.

Better still, there are both 650b and 700c options available with a chunky 55 per cent discount at Chain Reaction Cycles.

  • Buy the WTB Byway tyres with a 55% saving from Chain Reaction Cycles

Giro Foray road helmet – £79.99 £54.99 (save 31%)

Immediate Media

The Giro Foray MIPS is a classically styled helmet that our testers found to be very comfortable. The added protection afforded by the helmet’s MIPS liner is also very welcome on a helmet at this price.

  • Buy the Giro Foray MIPS helmet with a 31% saving from Chain Reaction Cycles 

Specialized S-Works EXOS shoes — £450 £241 (save 46%) 

Specialized

The Specialized S-Works EXOS is a stylish, featherweight race shoe (the pair tip the scales at 347g) ideal for hot, summer rides, especially when climbing on the continent.

Our tester liked the fit, comfort (despite their stiffness) and performance, only finding fault with the price. But now they are available from Sigma Sports in a handful of sizes at nearly 50 per cent off.

  • Buy the Specialized S-Works EXOS with a 46% saving from Sigma Sports

Alé Graphics PRR Strada bib shorts — £100 £39.99 (save 60%)

Jack Luke / Immediate Media

The Alé PRR bib shorts are comfortable, fit accurately, and are jazzy too – if that’s your taste. Our tester gave the women-specific Green Road bibs four stars in a recent review and judged them good value.

Now they deliver even more bang for your buck, with a stonking 60 per cent discount on the darker colours from Wiggle.

  • Buy the Alé Graphics PRR Strada bib shorts with a 60% saving from Wiggle 

Black Friday cycling deals: quick links

  • Amazon – The retail giant’s ‘Black Friday Week’ sale runs until 30 November
  • Chain Reaction Cycles – New Black Friday deals released every Friday
  • Currys PC World – The store’s ‘Black Fri-Yay’ sale is underway
  • eBay – Reductions galore in the auction site’s pre-Black Friday sale
  • Garmin – A number of the brand’s watches are on sale at Amazon
  • Halfords – A wide range of Black Friday deals already online
  • Tredz – ‘Black Ticket’ event with significant discounts on ‘nearly new’ ex-demo and ex-display bikes
  • Wiggle – The Wiggle ‘Brighter Black Friday’ sale features discounts on a huge range of products

What is Black Friday?

Traditionally taking place the day after Thanksgiving, Black Friday has been going on for decades in the US. It’s become more popular lately in the UK, getting bigger and lasting longer each year

Further down this page, we’ll also delve into Cyber Monday and how it’s different from Black Friday.

When will Black Friday 2021 cycling deals be released?

Andy Lloyd / Immediate Media

Black Friday 2021 takes place on 26 November, but it no longer lasts for a single day. Rather, the discounting continues for at least a fortnight. In recent years, some retailers even unveiled early-bird ‘pre-Black Friday’ sales in mid-November, as seen above.

We’re sure we’ll see some hot cycling deals released before the big day. The question is: will they better Black Friday itself? It’s hard to say.

As many studies have now shown, Black Friday Deals aren’t always as spectacular as they might appear to be. Historic price comparison tools such as CamelCamelCamel are well worth using to ensure you aren’t getting caught up in the hype.

That said, there are usually a few gems tucked away in the dusty corners of each retailer’s site, and you can rely on BikeRadar to do the digging and find these for you.

How to get a good deal on Black Friday 2021

  • A little research goes a long way. Read a few online reviews before you commit to buy. There may be a reason for that 40 per cent discount
  • Have you actually thought about what you want to buy? We recommend you put together a wishlist in advance so you don’t come to regret a rash decision
  • Take price drops with a pinch of salt: they can often be hugely exaggerated, since they’re listed against an RRP that might be years old. Luckily, we track deal prices and do our best to let you know about a product’s price history so you know you’re definitely getting the best deal
  • Don’t let the stress get to you! If you see a deal that’s marked as ‘nearly out of stock’, add it to your shopping basket straight away. Then take a look at the prices that other retailers are advertising. You normally get at least a couple of minutes before the item leaves your basket.

Should I wait for Cyber Monday?

Jack Luke / Immediate Media

What used to be the online-exclusive sequel to Black Friday, Cyber Monday is becoming obsolete. We make an ever greater proportion of purchases on the web than in brick-and-mortar shops. Retailers now seldom offer deals either just in-store or online.

However, the absence of Covid restrictions in the UK this year (touch wood) will inevitably lead to more shop tills ringing than in last winter’s lockdown. Perhaps physical stores will keep back some deals for Cyber Monday.

What does this mean for you?  Expect a hectic four-day period of sales from 26 to 29 November and, if you see a barnstorming bargain on Black Friday, we don’t advise hanging on for the price to drop on Cyber Monday.
author: Jack Evans
